document.masterDocTitle: Reports of Galathea Fabricius, 1793 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Anomura: Galatheidae) from Chinese waters, with descriptions of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Reports of Galathea Fabricius, 1793 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Anomura: Galatheidae) from Chinese waters, with descriptions of two new species

Distribution. Previously known from Madagascar , Mozambique Channel, Delagoa Bay, Cargados Carazos, Amirante, Saya De Malha Bank, Red Sea, Ryukyu Islands, Taiwan , South China Sea, Talaud and Holandia Bay, near Timor, Marsegu Island , Gorong Island , Ternate , Indonesia , New Guinea , Western Australia , Lifu, Loyalty Islands, Palau Islands, Yap Island ; intertidal to
146 m .
Now also known from South China Sea; intertidal to
50 m .

Remarks. The specimens agree with the previous descriptions of the species.
Galathea aegyptiaca
is a coral reef inhabitant.
